fields.description:
After adding a JIRA Issue Macro that shows a JIRA Service Desk project, and the Time to Resolution field (default SLA field) or any custom SLA field, no SLA times appear in the Confluence page the JIRA Issue Macro is included in

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Install JIRA, JIRA Service Desk, and Confluence
# Create a JSD Project
# Create an issue in the project
# Create a Space and Page in Confluence
# Embed a JIRA Issue Macro in the page displaying the Project created above
** Ensure that the Time to Resolution field is included

h3. Expected behavior
SLA times are shown in the list of issues for the Time to Resolution column

h3. Actual behavior
The column is empty see the following image:
!issue_macro.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro Does Not Display SLA Time with JIRA and JIRA Service Desk Tickets

fields.description:
When using Confluence within Chrome, the find (Control+F) functionality does not scroll the screen when the word is found.  The functionality works correctly in other browsers, but this issue is specific to Chrome.  

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence with enough text to make the user need to scroll in order to see the end.
# Enter the editor by hitting the *edit* button
# Type Control+F to open the find functionality
# In the *Find* search box, type a word that is at the end of the document
# Click the *Next* Button

h2. Expected Behavior
In other browsers, and expected in Chrome, would be for the screen to scroll to the highlighted word you are searching for

h2. Actual Behavior
The screen does not appear to change in any way.  If you manually scroll down, you can see the word that was searched for is highlighted.  The page does not scroll to the highlighted word that was searched for.
fields.summary: When Using a Chrome Browser and Editing a Confluence Page, the Find (Control+F) Functionality Does Not Scroll the Screen

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36062].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

At the moment, user don't have any description or warning before they can export their  space or page from  Confluence OnDemand Instance. User only can see the warning when they want to create backup in Confluence OnDemand.

*Example*
User would like to export their space or page from Confluence Cloud to Confluence 5.6.3 but they will be facing an error where they unable to complete their restoration into Self-Hosted Confluence. The reason being is that only the latest version in OD (cloud) is compatible with the latest version in server, and that version is OD 5.6-OD-39, as mentioned on this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Migrating+from+Confluence+Cloud+to+Confluence+Server#MigratingfromConfluenceCloudtoConfluenceServer-UpgradingtoastandardConfluenceServerrelease].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36053].
  {panel}

There was a feature prior to Confluence 3.5 that would make plain text issue keys to render as hyperlinks to their respective JIRA issue in the JIRA project linked to the Confluence space the page is located in. The lack of this feature was raised here: [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23693].

This functionality is present on Cloud (OnDemand) and when exporting a space/project to a local installation, these links simply disappear.

The functionality on Cloud is provided by the *Confluence Applinks Transformer Plugin* ({{com.atlassian.confluence.confluence-applinks-transformer-plugin}}), which is not available, neither is compatible with any local installation.

Please provide this plugin/functionality for BTF releases.
fields.summary: Application Link issue key not rendering after migration from Cloud instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36044].
{panel}
*Summary*
When I insert a JIRA Issue/Filter macro on a Confluence page as a table, a long text is not wrapped and the width of the column is fixed by the length of the text. 
 If the the page is then exported to Word or PDF, the table either runs off the page (Word) or columns are missing entirely (PDF).

*Update*: The Change History macro is causing this issue. After removing the Change History macro from the Confluence page, the text is wrapping as expected and all the table columns I have defined are visible on the page even after exporting to Word and PDF formats.

Note: Depending on the number of columns defined,JIRA Issue/Filter Macro tables are prone to overflow the page when exported.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Add the Jira Issues macro to a page. Include a field in the configuration that contains a long text description.
 # Save the page and note that the text does wrap correctly. 
 # Edit the page again. Add the Change History macro to the page and save.

*Expected Results:*
The text wrapping will correctly render on the page. 

*Actual Results:*
The word wrapping is removed from the issues macro and you have to scroll horizontally to read the text.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue/Filter Macro table column widths are not sizeable

fields.description:
We use Confluence to publish customer-facing documentation. Within that documentation, some repetitive data, that is likely to change at some point (such as e-mail adresses) are placed in snippet-pages, and then displayed using the Page Include.

This works quite nice for the Page, except when this include happens to be inside an Excerpt macro, which is then used by the Children Display macro. This macro does not render the text on the embedded page, instead it renders the name of the included page.

See attached example.

I can imagine there are limitations as to what can be part of an excerpt, but since it can include formatting like headers, tables and bullets, I would assume a simple page include would not pose a problem
fields.summary: Children Display macro does not render Page Includes from Excerpt
Allow subscript/superscript/strike-through in page title

fields.description:
We now enable GC Logging by default, on Linux and Windows instances that are started using the batch file. It would be nice to have this enable by default on Windows services as well.

This could be achieved by adding the parameters in the service section of [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Enable+Garbage+Collection+Logging] to _service.bat_ in the distribution, so any service created will automatically have GC logging.
fields.summary: Add GC logging to Windows Services created by default.

Hi team,

Need your help in resolving the following bug asap. Any help would be much appreciated.

*Issue:* I have a couple of epics and some stories associated with each of them in JIRA. When I created a wiki page in Confluence, I inserted some issues from JIRA using "JIRA Issue/Filter" built-in macro to display all the Epics and their respective stories in a table. 
While all the other attributes appear correctly +I am not able to get to display, the names of the Epics in the table+. I have included +Epic Name+ and +Epic Link+ both the columns, but Epic Name column in the table is empty, while Epic Link just populates the JIRA Id of the Epic in question.

*Ultimately, I need to display Epic Names in the table and not their ids.* Please suggest how this could be fixed.

+*Also, for your reference, please find the screen shot attached with the ticket*+

h3.Update

This issue seems to also affect other fields like Version. When user generates a report; instead of showing the version number; it shows the version ID instead.

For example. 

{code}
jira=> select * from projectversion where id = 17718;
  id   | project | vname | description | sequence | released | archived | url | releasedate | startdate 
-------+---------+-------+-------------+----------+----------+----------+-----+-------------+-----------
 17718 |   11200 | 1.9   |             |       10 |          |          |     |             | 
(1 row)
{code}

When a report is generated; instead of showing version 1.9 for an issue in a report; it shows 17718 instead.

fields.description:
If you have a user without a email added into a group and try to share a page with that group the notification will show as "Sent" in the sharing work box, however the emails will not be send to any of the group's member.

Confluence *does not allow blank emails* when users are added, however if you add those users trough a user directory (AD/LDAP) you will be able to reproduce the scenario of this bug

h4. Steps to reproduce.
# Set up a AD/LDAP.
# Add the following users as per bellow image in AD/LDAP:
!img.PNG|thumbnail!
(i) In above scenario I added a valid email on admin user and Bruce Banner user.
# Create a user directory to synchronize those users.
# Setup a mail server in Confluence.
# Create the following groups:
#* test1
#* test2
#* test3
# In "test1" add the following users:
#* aarons
#* admin
#* bbanner
# In "test2" add the following users:
#* admin
#* aevans
#* bbanner
# In "test3" add the following users:
#* admin
#* bbanner
# Create a blank Page.
# Share the page with test3 group.
(i) This group have emails added into all it's members.
# Note that you will get a notification, which is expected.
# Now share with test1 group. 
(i) The first member does not have a email added.
# You will get a sent confirmation in the workbox.
# Notice that your valid accounts will not get the emails as they got with test3 group.
# There are no errors in the logs and neither in the Confluence mail queues.
# If you use test2 group, which have the first user with a valid email and the second user with a blank email, you will get a notification to the "admin" user but not for "bbanner".

h4. Workaround

If you remove the users that have blank emails from the target group and share it again, it will work as expected.
fields.summary: Blank emails affects the group sharing functionality

For example, if a data entered recently it will be green, if the data already entered more than 8 hours, it will changed to yellow, if the data is already more than 16 hours, it will turned to brown, if it's more then 24 hours, it will turned to red.

if we could adjust the data expiry our self will be even better!

So that the admissions, based on the red color, can see noticed it by glace to update the data or finish the task.

fields.description:
As of 5.6 when we implemented G1GC as the default, in setenv.sh/setenv.bat, the default environment variable for JVM parameters has changed to CATALINA_OPTS, instead of JAVA_OPTS.

This has the potential to cause confusion for customers:
* If both exist and specify different parameters, which will be effective?
* Customers may change one and not the other, and expect their changes to be picked up. This can greatly increase troubleshooting time
* Documentation may reference one or the other and customers may have difficulty implementing advised changes, and need to contact Support (friction)

For Support:
* We now have to update documentation to give different advice based on versions, eg [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties]
* Support engineers need to know that this changed, so we can advise customers of the correct method depending on their version
fields.summary: JAVA_OPTS has changed to CATALINA_OPTS

fields.description:
Background
==========
I was working in two different spaces; the keys are WOL and RIT. I created 4 how-to articles (using my edited template) in the RIT space, which
automatically produced an index page (Content Report Table).

Steps to reproduce
==================
1. I moved the index page from the RIT space to the WOL space using the
Tools->Move menu item, which appeared to move all the how-to articles
automatically with it (nice, I thought).
2. Now in the WOL space, I added a new how-to article but found that it does not appear in the index.
3. Tried adding a new how-to in the RIT space; a new index was generated but it showed no content.
4. Edited the index page to ensure that the Content Report Table macro was referring to the correct label and space; it was (kb-how-to-article and RIT or WOL as applicable). Couldn't see any problem there.
5. Moved everything back to the RIT space. I could see the 4 original articles now in the index; but not any new ones I added.

As far as I can tell something happened in the backend when I did step 1. Now no matter what I do I cannot get any new how-to articles to appear in the index page.

I feel like something needs to get reset in the backend. What's weird is even
if I go to my third space (key WOLDOC) and try to create a how-to article, it also doesn't show up in the index! So it seems like something is messed up in all of my spaces. 

Tried the following:
1. Went to the WOL space.
2. Created a new template (from scratch) for the index page, called "Concept Article Index". Modelled it on the existing similar index templates, with a create button, horizontal rule and content report table macro.
3. Created a new template for a "concept article", giving it a label of
"wol-concept-article"
4. Edited the "Concept Article Index" template so that the create button
creates a page with label "wol-concept-article"
5. Created an page based on template "Concept Article Index", called
"Concepts"
6. Used the "Add Concept article" button on this page to create a concept
article "Concept 1". Verified that it has the correct label "wol-concept-article" and it is obviously in the WOL space.
7. Checked the "Concepts" page to see if "Concept 1" shows up. It doesn't.
8. Added the "wol-concept-article" label to 4 other pages. None of them show up in the "Concepts" page either. It simply says "No content found", which is obviously not true!

Somehow, ALL of my index pages (whether created from scratch like above, or via a canned template and auto-generated) have this issue of not showing any of the content they are supposed to be showing!!

This is a huge issue for our team, because we use index pages as the first
point of entry for all our content areas. 

Note that the page tree in the sidebar shows that the child pages exist, and
they are in the right place (not that place should matter in a content table
report which only seems to need the label). But we don't want to use the
sidebar for navigation; we only want to use the panels and links shown on the top-level "home" page.
fields.summary: Pages I create don't show up in their corresponding index page

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page with a code block macro
# Enter this text into the code block (two lines are required because it strips whitespace from the first line):
{code}
line 1
        line 2
{code}
#- NB: This was created by typing ordinary spaces with the space bar
# Save the page
# Double click inside the code block to highlight all the text. 
#- NB: You will see the text indent slightly, and the numbers that were green are now black (syntax highlighting is off). This is the copy mode I am referring to.
# Copy the text
# Paste it into [this character identifier|http://www.babelstone.co.uk/Unicode/whatisit.html] and convert it
# You will see that the indenting spaces are no-break spaces:
{code}
LATIN SMALL LETTER N
LATIN SMALL LETTER E
SPACE
DIGIT ONE
SPACE
NO-BREAK SPACE
NO-BREAK SPACE
NO-BREAK SPACE
NO-BREAK SPACE
NO-BREAK SPACE
NO-BREAK SPACE
NO-BREAK SPACE
NO-BREAK SPACE
LATIN SMALL LETTER L
LATIN SMALL LETTER I
LATIN SMALL LETTER N
LATIN SMALL LETTER E
SPACE
DIGIT TWO
{code}

h3. Explanation
This is by design. [This article|http://listarchives.libreoffice.org/global/users/msg37200.html] explains the behaviour of browsers and why they require non-breaking spaces in order to not compact all the spaces into a single whitespace character. Some text editors will display these characters as non-breaking spaces, while some will not.

h3. Workarounds
# You may not need to do anything at all - if you want to retain the formatting, these characters will simply ensure that the whitespace is exactly as intended.
# Edit the page and copy the contents of the code block from there.
# Click outside the code block to take it out of copy mode (so the syntax highlighting returns), and copy the contents of the code block by clicking outside of the box and dragging the selection area over the entire block. Repeat the same character identification test and you will see the characters are simply 'SPACE'.
See the attached video for a demonstration.
NB: This will not work for OpenOffice/LibreOffice, as explained [here|http://listarchives.libreoffice.org/global/users/msg37200.html].
# Copy and paste into a different text editor (eg Sublime Text), and then copy/paste the text again from there into your final destination (eg OpenOffice).
# Find and replace the characters in your text editor, eg find  '\u00a0' and replace with ' '
fields.summary: Code macro creates no-break spaces instead of ordinary spaces in copy mode

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35980].
  {panel}

Confluence's WebDAV is very convenient to work with attachments. Also Confluence provides an ability to edit page content as text file in WebDAV folder.
Admins can hide {{URLs}}, {{@versions}}, {{@exports}} using advanced options, described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence]. These options make view of WebDAV folder more clear, only folders for pages/spaces and attachments are visible.

But it is possible to edit pages as text files. Historically, WebDAV server was implemented in Confluence 2.3 (CONF-3431). Confluence pages had content in wiki format, and it was easy for human to open it, understand its content, edit it and save.
The main difference between Confluence 2.3 and Confluence 5.6 from this point of view is storage/edit format. Current format is not for manual editing, but for WYSIWYG editing style. And it is hard for user to *edit* these text files, unlike it was with old good plain wiki. Especially for non-tech users. Users became confused when see text files with abracadabra in WebDAV folder.

Please, add an option to hide these text files from WebDAV view, like ones for {{URLs}}, {{@versions}} and {{@exports}} virtual folders. Additionally, I think, it worths to make this option turned off by default, because most users in most installations anyway can't edit these file directly.

There are still use cases for showing text files - for example to publish auto-created pages (build tool, report tool, etc) in Confluence. But these cases are not widely used. System admin can turn on described option in its installation. In other cases these files should be hidden.

Additionally, please, see [this comment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence?focusedCommentId=695238827#comment-695238827].
fields.summary: Add ability to hide text files with pages content from WebDAV frolder
Add confirmation to Cancel link in edit mode.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35969].
  {panel}

h6. Steps to replicate
# Install Confluence 5.6-OD-39-039 with Oracle database
# Take XML space backup from Confluence OD
# Restore the XML backup into Confluence 5.6-OD-39-039

h6. Observed Behavior
!oracle.jpg|thumbnail!

h6. Expected Behavior
The restoration complete successfully without any error.

h6. Note:

The import works on Embeded HSQL, MySQL, Postegres and MSSQL, in case you are hitting this you could use one of the other supported databases as a workaround.


*Workaround*
# Delete any previously failed, half-imported space
# Run the following query in database:
{code}
alter table
CONTENT_PERM
DISABLE constraint
CP_UNIQUE_USER_GROUPS;
{code}
# Import Space
# Run the following query in database:
{code}
alter table
CONTENT_PERM
ENABLE constraint
CP_UNIQUE_USER_GROUPS;
{code}
(!) Please backup your database before running the above query.
fields.summary: XML space import failed from the latest OD for Oracle Database

Steps to reproduce:
1. Paste {code} scp XXXX:/data/example\ and\. ./ {code} into the confluence editor on a page.
2. Attempt to preview or save the document.
3. Observe that you cannot preview or save the comment as an error stating {quote}"The editor content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 523. Parser message: Unexpected character '=' (code 61) (expected a name start character) at..." {quote} 

When pasting text that could be a link we should not produce an invalid link such that the page cannot be saved.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35960].
  {panel}

Currently Confluence does not modify the email when it sends notification to users with favorited pages or spaces modifications.

For purposes of content control and to organize favorited contents notifications, it would be nice to have a different subject in the email when the application sends favorited contents notification to the specific users.

Example: User watches 2 pages:
Page A
Page B (favorited)

When it receives an email about updates in these pages:
Page A: Subject: "Content Updated on page A"
Page B: Subject: "Favorited Content Updated on page B"
fields.summary: Modify the watch email template for favorite pages and spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35946].
  {panel}

h4. Problem:
When using the *Insert Markup* tool while in edit mode of Confluence. If there's a whitespace after a H1 hash character, #, text will not render. 

h4. Duplication Steps:
# Enter edit mode for a Confluence page
# Select the *Markup* tool from the under *Insert* menu
# Select *Markdown* above the Insert text box
# Place the following text:
{noformat}
# Image Demo/Product/Newsworty Stuff
* NSFW Image classifier
* Age classifier
* Selfie classifier


# Text 
{noformat}
# Preview side will then display:
{noformat}
# Image Demo/Product/Newsworty Stuff * NSFW Image classifier * Age classifier * Selfie classifier # Text
{noformat}
# Move courser to line where "Text" and remove whitespace after Text
# Preview then renders correctly
fields.summary: Whitespace after #/H1 character in markdown doesn't render

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35945]. {panel} PDF Exports of wiki page with centered images don't include images. *Steps to reproduce:* # Create a page and insert an image jpg, png etc... # Export the page to PDF. You should see that the image(s) did export. # Edit the page and align the image to the center. # Export the page to PDF again. *Expected result:* Image shows in the center. *Actual result:* Image is not displayed. *Cause:* The alignment done using the image tags is not being exported: This is the "Storage Format" of a centered image that is not exported to PDF: {noformat}

{noformat} and this is the one of an image centered by using the workaround and is exported to PDF (without alignment) {noformat}

{noformat} *Workaround:* center-align the cursor +before+ including the image to the page. The image will be added in the center and will be displayed in PDF exports.
fields.summary: Export to PDF, Centered Images are not included in .pdf file

fields.description:
With IE11, the "Show or hide sidebar" control will hide the sidebar when clicked, but will not restore it when clicked again.  This apparently only happens with some spaces.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolio/JIRA+Portfolio+Home
2. Click "Show or hide sidebar" or type "[" (Sidebar disappears)
3. Click "Show or hide sidebar" or type "[" (IE11: Nothing happens, Chrome: Sidebar reappears)

The only way I could figure out how to get the sidebar back was to go to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/Atlassian+Documentation
where I was able to restore the sidebar with the above control. I have no idea why "Show or hide sidebar" works in this Space but doesn't work on in the JIRA Portfolio space.
fields.summary: Show sidebar doesn't work with IE11

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35943].
  {panel}

h5.steps to reproduce 1
# in a Confluence page, click *Insert > Files and images*;
# upload and insert an _.ico_ file;

*Result:* the file isn't rendered as an image, only a download link with a file name is displayed.

h5.steps to reproduce 2

fields.summary: Allow handling of .ico files in attachments and PDF exports

fields.description:
# Create table on confluence page
# Click into first cell and insert text "Foo"
# Press Tab key to advance into next cell
# Write text "Bar"

Result:
Editor shows "Foo" but not "Bar" but when page is submitted or previewed "Bar" is displayed as well. When when going back to editing from preview "Bar" is still inaccessible in editor.

Interestingly if you press Tab at the end of a table, the editor will add a new row and there you can use Tab and write text as normal.
fields.summary: Tab key in table produces invisible text

fields.description:
I get the following error message when trying to edit an Excel 2003 document attached to a wiki page in Excel 2003:

'http://.....' could not be opened

Editing Word 2003 documents and Powerpoint 2003 presentations all works fine.
fields.summary: Edit in Excel 2003 fails while Edit in Word 2003 and Powerpoint 2003 works

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the title text contains a special character (e.g. ?, : , ...), the title text and "alt text" are lost when the page is saved. For example: "Does this work" will persist, but "Does this work?" results in the entire string being lost.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Insert an image in the editor
2. On the property panel, click "properties"
3. Add some "title text" and "alt text" for the image that contains special character (e.g. ?,:...) and save the page
4. Hover over the image in view mode (or inspect the markup to check the value of the title attribute)

h3. Expected Results
The inserted text should be visible. 

h3. Actual Results
The text is not visible and the text is lost in the image proprieties
fields.summary: Image title text and alt text containing special characters is lost

fields.description:
When following the Simple Blueprint creation tutorial and trying to build the plugin using the FastDev button, the operation appears to hangs with "Opening port 4330 for socket cli access \n Waiting for commands..."

From this point forward, the FastDev button does not function. The only workaround at present is to open another command prompt window and then manually run:

{code}atlas-cli {code}

Within the Atlastutorial directory to obtain the maven prompt, and then run the *pi* command:

{code} maven> pi {code}

This does deploy the blueprint plugin into the Confluence development instance, but this is not included in the Simple Blueprint Tutorial.

Given this behavior, it does appear that the FastDev button is either not working correctly in Windows, or there is a missing set of instructions within the tutorial for users to successfully build the Simple Blueprint in Confluence.
fields.summary: FastDev Does Not Add BluePrint Plugin in Windows

fields.description:
we are unable to shutdown tomcat due to some memory leaks in confluence. Kindly see the attached log file. 

We are using OS- Solaris 10, Confluence - 5.6.4 (EAR/WAR distribution), Tomcat 7.0.55 and Oracle 11g. 
Please note: we ensured the oracle driver is placed in the tomcat's lib directory, as most blogs and comments say that the JDBC drivers are the root cause of the memory leak issue. 

Also some suggests to disable the tomcat's "JreMemoryLeakPreventionListener", which exist in the server.xml. However, the solution doesn't clearly explain, what would be the implications if we disable the listener. We haven't tested this solution yet. Could you please point us in right direction to get this issue resolved?

How to reproduce the issue?
on a unix environment, 
1) download confluence EAR/WAR distribution
2) build and deploy the confluence war file on a shared tomcat (version 7). And setup confluence using confluence wizard.
3) configure to connect to a oracle 11g database.
4) Restore confluence site (preferably from 4.X.X).
5) Give it some time and perform some operations in the newly restored confluence site.
6) Try stopping the server. You should see some memory leak errors. (in Tomcat's Catalina.out log)
fields.summary: Tomcat is not shutting down properly as its trying to prevent memory leaks in Confluence

fields.description:
After I tell the editor to insert a new table row below, the PRIMARY selection is replaced as if everything from the beginning of the page were selected; the current PRIMARY selection is obliterated.

h3. Steps to reproduce (requires windows)

1. Create a new page
2. Add some text "This is a test"
3. Select text
4. Add a table (3x3) using the editor add table feature
5. Insert my cursor into the table
6. Click the add row button on the editor toolbar and confirm that a new row is generated
7. Paste the previously copied text
8. Observe that the text that has been pasted is the same as that which i had previously copied
fields.summary: Inserting a new row below modifies the PRIMARY selection

fields.description:
It seems that Confluence has the same design bug as JIRA when it comes to sending notifications to users that never logged in.

This bug is very annoying when you deploy the product to a large enterprise, when only few people are users from the beginning and slowly they start to add watchers, mentions, emails to people that never logged to the system.

Obviously these people would become users if they would ever login, but they will never be notified... so it is a chicken and the egg problem.

I see only two workarounds on this: prevent the usage of non-users in all dropdowns or even better, auto creation of their accounts (default groups assignment) when they are used (by anyone).
fields.summary: notifications are not send until a user logs-in first time - LDAP
Improve page comparison: only show changed parts of a tables
LiveSearch Macro to have increased 'Label' functionality

fields.description:
We had a situation on our production instance confluence.atlassian.com where two cluster nodes got into a deadlocked state. Fortunately, one of the other nodes remained unaffected and was able to continue serving requests, so it did not bring down the whole cluster.

Here is the scenario:

*node1*
* All hazelcast listener threads were attempting to process near cache entry invalidations messages
* In order to do this, they need to deserialize the class of the cache key.
* This, in turn, requires loading of the correct key class
* The ConfluenceUberClassLoader delegates out to the pluginClassLoader, which is synchronous.

So by this point we have all the listener threads all waiting for the class loading lock. Now:

* One thread holds the lock, is attempting to load the class of the cache key to invalidate.
* In order to fetch the correct classloader, it needs to check that the right plugin is enabled.
* To check a plugin is enabled, it queries the PluginStateStore
* The CachingPluginStateStore is stored in a near cache, so usually this call is fast. However in this case the near cache had been invalidated
* So in order to read the state of the plugin system, the PluginStateStore had to be reloaded from the cache.
* The partition of the cache needed was on another node, so Hazelcast attempts to read it with a remote operation

So by now we have all the threads on node1 waiting for the classloader, which in turn is waiting for the PluginStateStore, which is stored on another node so is waiting for a remote cache operation.

The stack trace for the thread attempting the operation:
{code}
"async-entry-listener-19" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00007f4098a90800 nid=0x7d26 in Object.wait() [0x00007f3ff39bc000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	at com.hazelcast.spi.impl.BasicInvocationFuture.waitForResponse(BasicInvocationFuture.java:194)
	- locked <0x000000077d63ea60> (a com.hazelcast.spi.impl.BasicInvocationFuture)
	at com.hazelcast.spi.impl.BasicInvocationFuture.get(BasicInvocationFuture.java:166)
	at com.hazelcast.spi.impl.BasicInvocationFuture.get(BasicInvocationFuture.java:146)
	at com.hazelcast.map.proxy.MapProxySupport.invokeOperation(MapProxySupport.java:337)
	at com.hazelcast.map.proxy.MapProxySupport.getInternal(MapProxySupport.java:240)
	at com.hazelcast.map.proxy.MapProxyImpl.get(MapProxyImpl.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.hazelcast.nearcache.NearCacheLoader.load(NearCacheLoader.java:25)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.hazelcast.monitoring.ConfluenceMonitoringLoader.load(ConfluenceMonitoringLoader.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.EhCacheManager$3$1.createEntry(EhCacheManager.java:168)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.SelfPopulatingCache.get(SelfPopulatingCache.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:74)

	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.CachingPluginStateStore.load(CachingPluginStateStore.java:47)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor62.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)

{code}

*node2*
Node 2's threads were all stuck trying to load the same cache value (from a Hibernate L2 cache) from a remote cache (node1's). Since all of node1's HZ listener threads were used up waiting, node2's threads got stuck too, waiting for a response from node1. *Deadlock*

*What we can do about it:*
The crux of the problem is what is happening on node1:

Cache Operation -> load class -> read plugin state -> remote cache operation

This circular dependence on cache operations is what leaves us open to deadlocks. This is particularly an issue because the PluginStateStore is needed for pretty much everything.

[~oburn] had a great idea: Make the PluginStateStore NOT a regular cache, but a local data store, always. Have it listen to application events to keep itself up to date asynchronously (we do this anyway with plugin events). Ensure it always has a value, so reading the plugin system state is always reliable, and fast. This would allow the threads on node1 to untangle themselves and "bottom out" at a local call, rather than a remote one.
